member.summary: Content scaling - None, Fit to margins, Shrink to margins or Custom scale

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.SinglePdfDocumentPrintSettings.CustomScale
member.summary: Scales the content to the specified value. To be used, the value of must be set to . Default value is 100%.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.SinglePdfDocumentPrintSettings.Margins
member.summary: Applies the margins. Units are 1/100 inch (i.e. 100 = 1 inch). Setting influences the print result. When set to , the margins are adjusted (if needed) to preserve the actual size of the print content. And when content is smaller, existing whitespace is considered as part of margin space. For all other values, the print content size is adjusted (if needed) to preserve the specified margins. Default value is (0,0,0,0).

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.SinglePdfDocumentPrintSettings.PageAutoSize
member.summary:
If set to true, automatically sets printer paper size according to page size of each page in the PDF. Size will be set if printer supports that paper size. If successful, it will override property. Default value is false. It doesnt't have effect in PrintWithAdobe.
See also:

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.SinglePdfDocumentPrintSettings.AllowCustomSize
member.summary: Used only in combination with = true. If the PDF page size isn't found in the list of available printer paper sizes, it will try to set the custom paper size. Most virtual PDF printers support the custom paper size, and most physical printers don't. The default value is false.

member.name: T:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint
member.summary: PdfPrint

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.PageAutoSize
member.summary:
If set to true, automatically sets printer paper size according to page size of each page in the PDF. Size will be set if printer supports that paper size. If successful, it will override property. Default value is false. It doesnt't have effect in PrintWithAdobe.
See also:

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.PaperSourceTrayInfo
member.summary: List of paper source tray names and supported page sizes for that tray. It must be manully set. It is used in combination when PageAutoSize doesn't work on its own. It is ignored if PageAutoSize = false.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.AllowCustomSize
member.summary: Used only in combination with = true. If the PDF page size isn't found in the list of available printer paper sizes, it will try to set the custom paper size. Most virtual PDF printers support the custom paper size, and most physical printers don't. The default value is false.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.IsContentCentered
member.summary: If set to true, it will center content in standard Print method. It doesn't have effect in PrintWithAdobe method. Default value is True.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.CheckPrinterExistence
member.summary: If set to false, it will not check for printer name existence if the non-default printer is used. This is useful in a situation where checking of the printer existence is slow due to many printers or some network printer. Default value is true.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.Watermark
member.summary: Watermark to be printed (it can be Image or Text).

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.UseOldPrintingSystem
member.summary: This uses .NET built-in printing API. It is (much) slower for some printers, but for some printers this is the only way it will work. Default value is false.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.Collate
member.summary: If set to true, it will collate the pages. If set to false, it will not collate the pages. If not set, it will use the printer default settings.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.PrinterName
member.summary: Name of the printer used for printing. If not set, it will use the default printer.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.Scale
member.summary: If set, it will scale the page according to the chosen scale type. If not set, it will use the Shrink scaling type. If PrintWithAdobe method both Shrink and FitToMargins behaves like Shrink.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.CustomScale
member.summary: If set, it will scale the page according to the specified value. To be used, must be set to . Default value is 100%.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.Margins
member.summary: If set, it will apply the margins. Units are 1/100 inch (i.e. 100 = 1 inch). Setting influences the print result. When set to , the margins are adjusted (if needed) to preserve the actual size of the print content. If opposite margins are set, their values are canceled out, applying only the remaining value (if any). If non-opposite margins are set, their value positions ("pushes") the content. For all other values, the print content size is adjusted (if needed) to preserve the specified margins. Default value is (0,0,0,0).

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.Pages
member.summary: Defines the pages that are to be printed. Pages and page intervals can be specified explicitly (ex.: 1,2,3,4), using ranges (ex.: 1-4), and in forward (ex.: 1-4,5,6), reverse (ex.: 6,5,4-1) or mixed order (ex. 5,1-4,6). If not set, all pages will be printed. If PrintWithAdobe method is used, Pages can't have more than one interval defined.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.Copies
member.summary: Set the number of copies to be printed. If not selected, it will use the printer default settings. When used for multi document printing, it represents the number of copies for the entire printer job.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.InverseForm
member.summary: It forces content of AdobeForm to be rendered before the page. Needed in some rare cases. It doesn't have effect in PrintWithAdobe method. Default is false.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.DuplexType
member.summary: Duplex type used in printing. If not set, it will use the printer default settings.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.SettingDialog
member.summary: Use the printer settings dialog. If not set, it will not use the printer settings dialog.
member.remarks: NOTE: Will not work if not used in Windows desktop environment

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.PrintInColor
member.summary: If set to true, it will print in color. If set to false, it will print as grayscale. If not set, it will use the printer default settings.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.IsLandscape
member.summary: If set to true, it will print as landscape if IsAutoRotate = false. If set to false, it will print as portrait if IsAutoRotate = false. If not set, it will use the printer default settings.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.IsAutoRotate
member.summary: If set to true, it will override selected value for IsLandscape and it will set orientation to landscape or portrait based on the content width / height. If not set, selected value for IsLandscape will be used. It doesn't have effect in PrintWithAdobe method.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.PaperSize
member.summary:
What type of paper size to use? If not set, it will use the printer default settings.
See also:

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.PaperSource
member.summary: Paper source used for printing. If not set, it will use the printer default settings.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.PrinterResolution
member.summary: Printer resolution used for printing. If not set, it will use the printer default settings.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.RangeType
member.summary: Range type. If not set, it will print both even and odd pages in the selected range interval.

member.name: M:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.CancelCurrentPrinting
member.summary: Cancels the current printing.

member.param: Company name of the license owner.

member.name: T:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.ScaleTypes
member.summary: Defines available scale types for the page content.

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.ScaleTypes.None
member.summary:
No scaling. Uses actual size.
Any content within printer hard margins will not be printed because of printer limitations.

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.ScaleTypes.Shrink
member.summary:
Shrink content to margins. Shrinks only if oversized, otherwise no scaling performed.
Content is scaled within printer hard margins.

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.ScaleTypes.FitToMargins
member.summary:
Fit content within margins.
Content is scaled within printer hard margins.

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.ScaleTypes.CustomScale
member.summary:
Scale content based on specified value, set with property.
Content is scaled within printer hard margins.

member.name: T:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.TiffCompression
member.summary: Compression used in Tiff images

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.TiffCompression.CompressionCCITT3
member.summary: CCCITT4 compression is mostly used for black and white images - 1 bit images.

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.TiffCompression.CompressionCCITT4
member.summary: CCCITT4 compression is mostly used for black and white images - 1 bit images.

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.TiffCompression.CompressionLZW
member.summary: LZW compression. Default value.

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.TiffCompression.CompressionNone
member.summary: No compression.

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.ColorBitsType.Bit24
member.summary: 24 bits are used for pixel: 8 bits each are used for the red, green and blue components.

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.ColorBitsType.Bit32
member.summary: 32 bits are used for pixel: 8 bits each are used for the alpha, red, green, and blue components.

member.name: T:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.Status
member.summary: Status of PDFPrint operation execution

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.Status.OK
member.summary: Everything is OK.

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.Status.FILE_DOESNT_EXIST
member.summary: File doesn't exist.

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.Status.CANNOT_PRINT_FILE
member.summary: Cannot print file.

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.Status.PRINTER_DOESNT_EXIST
member.summary: Printer doesn't exist.

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.Status.INVALID_DEVMOD
member.summary: Invalid printer properties structure.

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.Status.NOT_AVAILABLE_PRINTER_PROPERTIES
member.summary: Printer properties are not available.

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.Status.CANT_INITIALIZE_PRINTER
member.summary: Can't initialize printer.

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.Status.PASSWORD_INVALID
member.summary: Invalid password for password protected PDF.

member.name: F:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrint.Status.INVALID_PDF
member.summary: Not a valid PDF file.

member.name: T:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrintPageSettings
member.summary: print page settings

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrintPageSettings.Bounds
member.summary: Gets the rectangular area that represents the total area of the page taking into account the Landscape property. Most printers cannot print at the very edge of the page.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrintPageSettings.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the page is printed in color.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrintPageSettings.HardMarginX
member.summary: Gets the x-coordinate, in hundredths of an inch, of the hard margin (the physical margin set by the printer) at the left of the page.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrintPageSettings.HardMarginY
member.summary: Gets the y-coordinate, in hundredths of an inch, of the hard margin (the physical margin set by the printer) at the top of the page.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrintPageSettings.Landscape
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the page should be printed in landscape or portrait orientation.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrintPageSettings.Margins
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the user defined margins for this page. Units are 1/100 inch (i.e. 100 = 1 inch). Setting influences the print result. When set to , the margins are adjusted (if needed) to preserve the actual size of the print content. And when content is smaller, existing whitespace is considered as part of margin space. For all other values, the print content size is adjusted (if needed) to preserve the specified margins. Default value is (0,0,0,0).

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrintPageSettings.PaperSize
member.summary: Paper size

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrintPageSettings.PrintableArea
member.summary: A RectangleF representing the length and width, in hundredths of an inch, of the area the printer is capable of printing in. Returns the correct value, whether the page orientation is landscape or portrait.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrintPageSettings.PrinterResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the printer resolution for the page.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrintPageSettings.PaperSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the paper source (i.e. upper bin).

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrintPageSettings.Scale
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale type for the page. If not set, it will use the Shrink scaling type. If PrintWithAdobe method both Shrink and FitToMargins behaves like Shrink.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrintPageSettings.CustomScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom scale to scale the page. To be used, must be set to . Default value is 100%.

member.name: M:PdfPrintingNet.PdfPrintPageSettings.Copy
member.summary: Creates a new object of PdfPrintPageSettings and copies all properties
member.returns: new PdfPrintPageSettings object

member.name: T:PdfPrintingNet.PdfWatermark
member.summary: Watermark on printed PDF document

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfWatermark.Image
member.summary: If set, it will draw image at X,Y at angle of RotationAngle property.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfWatermark.X
member.summary: Absolute or relative X position. It is related with UseRelativeCoordinates.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfWatermark.Y
member.summary: Absolute or relative Y position. It is related with UseRelativeCoordinates.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfWatermark.UseRelativeCoordinates
member.summary: If set to true than X and Y are in percentage of paper size.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfWatermark.UseRelativeTextSize
member.summary: If set to true than text size is relative to 100% page size. Exampple: if defined font size is 12 than for 50% page size displayed font size will be 6. Default is false.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfWatermark.UseRelativeImageSize
member.summary: If set to true than image size is relative to 100% page size. Exampple: if defined image size is 120 x 120 than for 50% page size displayed image size will be 60 x 60. Default is false.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfWatermark.RotationAngle
member.summary: Rotation angle of watermark.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfWatermark.TextFont
member.summary: Watermark text font used for drawing value of Text property.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfWatermark.Text
member.summary: Is set, it will draw text at X,Y at angle of RotationAngle propery.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfWatermark.TextColor
member.summary: Color of watermark text.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfWatermark.PrintWatermark
member.summary: If true, this watermark will be printed if a PDF with it is printed. Default is true.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfWatermark.IsSet
member.summary: Returns true or false - based on that if Image or Text for watermark is set.

member.name: P:PdfPrintingNet.PdfWatermark.Opacity
member.summary: Opacity value in percentage - 0 is invisible and at 100 isn't transparent at all.

member.summary: Constructor. Creates PdfWatermark object with default values.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphicsPdfPageOptions
member.summary: Specifies how the content of an existing PDF page and new content is combined.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphicsPdfPageOptions.Append
member.summary: The new content is inserted behind the old content and any subsequent drawing in done above the existing graphic.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphicsPdfPageOptions.Prepend
member.summary: The new content is inserted before the old content and any subsequent drawing in done beneath the existing graphic.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphicsPdfPageOptions.Replace
member.summary: The new content entirely replaces the old content and any subsequent drawing in done on a blank page.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of a text string relative to its layout rectangle

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineAlignment.Near
member.summary: Specifies the text be aligned near the layout. In a left-to-right layout, the near position is left. In a right-to-left layout, the near position is right.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineAlignment.Center
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned in the center of the layout rectangle.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineAlignment.Far
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned far from the origin position of the layout rectangle. In a left-to-right layout, the far position is right. In a right-to-left layout, the far position is left.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineAlignment.BaseLine
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned relative to its base line. With this option the layout rectangle must have a height of 0.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode
member.summary: Specifies the direction of a linear gradient.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode.Horizontal
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from left to right.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode.Vertical
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from top to bottom.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode.ForwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from upper left to lower right.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode.BackwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from upper right to lower left.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineCap
member.summary: Specifies the available cap styles with which an XPen object can start and end a line.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineCap.Flat
member.summary: Specifies a flat line cap.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineCap.Round
member.summary: Specifies a round line cap.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineCap.Square
member.summary: Specifies a square line cap.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineJoin
member.summary: Specifies how to join consecutive line or curve segments in a figure or subpath.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineJoin.Miter
member.summary: Specifies a mitered join. This produces a sharp corner or a clipped corner, depending on whether the length of the miter exceeds the miter limit

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineJoin.Round
member.summary: Specifies a circular join. This produces a smooth, circular arc between the lines.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineJoin.Bevel
member.summary: Specifies a beveled join. This produces a diagonal corner.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XMatrixOrder
member.summary: Specifies the order for matrix transform operations.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XMatrixOrder.Prepend
member.summary: The new operation is applied before the old operation.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XMatrixOrder.Append
member.summary: The new operation is applied after the old operation.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPageDirection
member.summary: Specifies the direction of the y-axis.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPageDirection.Downwards
member.summary: Increasing Y values go downwards. This is the default.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPageDirection.Upwards
member.summary: Increasing Y values go upwards. This is only possible when drawing on a PDF page. It is not implemented when drawing on a System.Drawing.Graphics object.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XSmoothingMode
member.summary: Specifies whether smoothing (or antialiasing) is applied to lines and curves and the edges of filled areas.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.Invalid
member.summary: Specifies an invalid mode.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.Default
member.summary: Specifies the default mode.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.HighSpeed
member.summary: Specifies high speed, low quality rendering.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.HighQuality
member.summary: Specifies high quality, low speed rendering.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.None
member.summary: Specifies no antialiasing.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.AntiAlias
member.summary: Specifies antialiased rendering.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XStringAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of a text string relative to its layout rectangle.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XStringAlignment.Near
member.summary: Specifies the text be aligned near the layout. In a left-to-right layout, the near position is left. In a right-to-left layout, the near position is right.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XStringAlignment.Center
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned in the center of the layout rectangle.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XStringAlignment.Far
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned far from the origin position of the layout rectangle. In a left-to-right layout, the far position is right. In a right-to-left layout, the far position is left.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XStyleSimulations
member.summary: Describes the simulation style of a font.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XStyleSimulations.None
member.summary: No font style simulation.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XStyleSimulations.BoldSimulation
member.summary: Bold style simulation.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XStyleSimulations.ItalicSimulation
member.summary: Italic style simulation.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XStyleSimulations.BoldItalicSimulation
member.summary: Bold and Italic style simulation.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XSweepDirection
member.summary: Defines the direction an elliptical arc is drawn.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XSweepDirection.Counterclockwise
member.summary: Specifies that arcs are drawn in a counter clockwise (negative-angle) direction.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XSweepDirection.Clockwise
member.summary: Specifies that arcs are drawn in a clockwise (positive-angle) direction.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfFontOptions
member.summary: Specifies details about how the font is used in PDF creation.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor
member.summary: Represents a RGB, CMYK, or gray scale color.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from a 32-bit ARGB value.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from a 32-bit ARGB value.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified 8-bit color values (red, green, and blue). The alpha value is implicitly 255 (fully opaque).

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the four ARGB component (alpha, red, green, and blue) values.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified System.Drawing.Color.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Int32,PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified alpha value and color.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Int32,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified alpha value and color.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromCmyk(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified CMYK values.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromCmyk(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified CMYK values.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromGrayScale(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified gray value.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromKnownColor(PdfEdit.Drawing.XKnownColor)
member.summary: Creates an XColor from the specified pre-defined color.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromKnownColor(System.Drawing.KnownColor)
member.summary: Creates an XColor from the specified pre-defined color.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromName(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an XColor from the specified name of a pre-defined color.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.ColorSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets the color space to be used for PDF generation.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.IsEmpty
member.summary: Indicates whether this XColor structure is uninitialized.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.op_Implicit(System.Drawing.Color)~PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor
member.summary: Implicit conversion from Color to XColor

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.ToGdiColor
member.summary: Creates a System.Drawing.Color object from this color.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is a Color structure and is equivalent to this Color structure.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.op_Equality(PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor,PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor)
member.summary: Determines whether two colors are equal.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.op_Inequality(PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor,PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor)
member.summary: Determines whether two colors are not equal.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.IsKnownColor
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this color is a known color.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.GetHue
member.summary: Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) hue value, in degrees, for this color.
member.returns: The hue, in degrees, of this color. The hue is measured in degrees, ranging from 0 through 360, in HSB color space.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.GetSaturation
member.summary: Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) saturation value for this color.
member.returns: The saturation of this color. The saturation ranges from 0 through 1, where 0 is grayscale and 1 is the most saturated.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.GetBrightness
member.summary: Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) brightness value for this color.
member.returns: The brightness of this color. The brightness ranges from 0 through 1, where 0 represents black and 1 represents white.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.A
member.summary: Gets or sets the alpha value the specifies the transparency. The value is in the range from 1 (opaque) to 0 (completely transparent).

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.R
member.summary: Gets or sets the red value.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.G
member.summary: Gets or sets the green value.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.B
member.summary: Gets or sets the blue value.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.C
member.summary: Gets or sets the cyan value.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.M
member.summary: Gets or sets the magenta value.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the yellow value.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.K
member.summary: Gets or sets the black (or key) value.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.GS
member.summary: Gets or sets the gray scale value.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.Empty
member.summary: Represents the null color.

member.summary: Special property for XmlSerializer only.

member.summary: WRONG: Gets the face name of this Font object. Indeed it returns the font family name.

member.summary: Gets the em-size of this font measured in the unit of this font object.

member.summary: Gets style information for this Font object.

member.summary: Indicates whether this XFont object is bold.

member.summary: Indicates whether this XFont object is underlined.

member.summary: Gets the PDF options of the font.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XFont.CellSpace
member.summary: Gets the cell space for the font. The CellSpace is the line spacing, the sum of CellAscent and CellDescent and optionally some extra space.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XFont.CellAscent
member.summary: Gets the cell ascent, the area above the base line that is used by the font.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XFont.CellDescent
member.summary: Gets the cell descent, the area below the base line that is used by the font.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XFont.Metrics
member.summary: Gets the font metrics.
member.value: The metrics.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XFont.GetHeight
member.summary: Returns the line spacing, in pixels, of this font. The line spacing is the vertical distance between the base lines of two consecutive lines of text. Thus, the line spacing includes the blank space between lines along with the height of the character itself.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XFont.GetHeight(PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphics)
member.summary: Returns the line spacing, in the current unit of a specified Graphics object, of this font. The line spacing is the vertical distance between the base lines of two consecutive lines of text. Thus, the line spacing includes the blank space between lines along with the height of

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XFont.Height
member.summary: Gets the line spacing of this font.

member.summary: Gets the GDI family.
member.value: The GDI family.

member.summary: Implicit conversion form Font to XFont

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XForm.DrawingFinished
member.summary: This function should be called when drawing the content of this form is finished. The XGraphics object used for drawing the content is disposed by this function and cannot be used for any further drawing operations. PDFEdit automatically calls this function when this form was used the first time in a DrawImage function.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphics.EndContainer(PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphicsContainer)

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphics.GraphicsStateLevel
member.summary: Gets the current graphics state level. The default value is 0. Each call of Save or BeginContainer increased and each call of Restore or EndContainer decreased the value by 1.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphics.ShearTransform(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies the specified shearing operation to the transformation matrix of this object by prepending it to the object's transformation matrix. ShearTransform is a synonym for SkewAtTransform. Parameter shearX specifies the horizontal skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. Parameter shearY specifies the vertical skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphics.ShearTransform(System.Double,System.Double,PdfEdit.Drawing.XMatrixOrder)
member.summary: Applies the specified shearing operation to the transformation matrix of this object in the specified order. ShearTransform is a synonym for SkewAtTransform. Parameter shearX specifies the horizontal skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. Parameter shearY specifies the vertical skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphics.SkewAtTransform(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies the specified shearing operation to the transformation matrix of this object by prepending it to the object's transformation matrix. ShearTransform is a synonym for SkewAtTransform. Parameter shearX specifies the horizontal skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. Parameter shearY specifies the vertical skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphics.SkewAtTransform(System.Double,System.Double,PdfEdit.Drawing.XPoint)
member.summary: Applies the specified shearing operation to the transformation matrix of this object by prepending it to the object's transformation matrix. ShearTransform is a synonym for SkewAtTransform. Parameter shearX specifies the horizontal skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. Parameter shearY specifies the vertical skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm
member.summary: Represents a so called 'PDF form external object', which is typically an imported page of an external PDF document. XPdfForm objects are used like images to draw an existing PDF page of an external document in the current document. XPdfForm objects can only be placed in PDF documents. If you try to draw them using a XGraphics based on an GDI+ context no action is taken if no placeholder image is specified. Otherwise the place holder is drawn.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.FromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an XPdfForm from a file.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.FromStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates an XPdfForm from a stream.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Frees the memory occupied by the underlying imported PDF document, even if other XPdfForm objects refer to this document. A reuse of this object doesn't fail, because the underlying PDF document is re-imported if necessary.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.PlaceHolder
member.summary: Gets or sets an image that is used for drawing if the current XGraphics object cannot handle PDF forms. A place holder is useful for showing a preview of a page on the display, because PDFEdit cannot render native PDF objects.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.Page
member.summary: Gets the underlying PdfPage (if one exists).

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.PageCount
member.summary: Gets the number of pages in the PDF form.

member.summary: Gets the width in point of the page identified by the property PageNumber.

member.summary: Gets the height in point of the page identified by the property PageNumber.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.PixelHeight
member.summary: Gets the height in point of the page identified by the property PageNumber.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.Size
member.summary: Get the size of the page identified by the property PageNumber.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.Transform
member.summary: Gets or sets the transformation matrix.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.PageNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the page number in the external PDF document this object refers to. The page number is one-based, i.e. it is in the range from 1 to PageCount. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.PageIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the page index in the external PDF document this object refers to. The page index is zero-based, i.e. it is in the range from 0 to PageCount - 1. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.ExtractPageNumber(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Extracts the page number if the path has the form 'MyFile.pdf#123' and returns the actual path without the number sign and the following digits.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPrivateFontCollection
member.summary:
Makes fonts that are not installed on the system available within the current application domain.
In Silverlight required for all fonts used in PDF documents.

member.summary: Adds the specified font data to the global PrivateFontCollection. Family name and style are automatically retrieved from the font.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPrivateFontCollection.Add(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Adds the specified font data to the global PrivateFontCollection. Family name and style are automatically retrieved from the font.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Fonts.FontResolverInfo.FaceName
member.summary: A name that uniquely identifies the font (not the family), e.g. the file name of the font. PDFEdit does not use this name internally, but passes it to the GetFont function of the IFontResolver interface to retrieve the font data.

member.summary: Indicates whether bold must be simulated. Bold simulation is not implemented in PDFEdit.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Fonts.GlobalFontSettings
member.summary: Provides functionality to specify information about the handling of fonts in the current application domain.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Fonts.GlobalFontSettings.DefaultFontName
member.summary: The name of the default font.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Fonts.GlobalFontSettings.FontResolver
member.summary: Gets or sets the global font resolver for the current application domain. This static function must be called only once and before any font operation was executed by PDFEdit. If this is not easily to obtain, e.g. because your code is running on a web server, you must provide the same instance of your font resolver in every subsequent setting of this property. In a web application set the font resolver in Global.asax.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Fonts.GlobalFontSettings.DefaultFontEncoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the default font encoding used for XFont objects where encoding is not explicitly specified. If it is not set, the default value is PdfFontEncoding.Unicode. If you are sure your document contains only Windows-1252 characters (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows-1252) set default encoding to PdfFontEncodingj.Windows1252. Must be set only once per app domain.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Fonts.IFontResolver
member.summary: Provides functionality that convertes a requested typeface into a physical font.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Fonts.IFontResolver.ResolveTypeface(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts specified information about a required typeface into a specific font.
member.param: Set to true when a bold fontface is required.
Set to true when an italic fontface is required.
member.returns: Information about the physical font, or null if the request cannot be satisfied.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Fonts.IFontResolver.GetFont(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the bytes of a physical font with specified face name.
member.param: A face name previously retrieved by ResolveTypeface.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Fonts.PlatformFontResolver

member.param: Indicates whether a bold font is requested.
Indicates whether an italic font is requested.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags
member.summary: Specifies the flags of AcroForm fields.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: If set, the user may not change the value of the field. Any associated widget annotations will not interact with the user; that is, they will not respond to mouse clicks or change their appearance in response to mouse motions. This flag is useful for fields whose values are computed or imported from a database.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Required
member.summary: If set, the field must have a value at the time it is exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.NoExport
member.summary: If set, the field must not be exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Pushbutton
member.summary: If set, the field is a pushbutton that does not retain a permanent value.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Radio
member.summary: If set, the field is a set of radio buttons; if clear, the field is a checkbox. This flag is meaningful only if the Pushbutton flag is clear.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.NoToggleToOff
F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.RadiosInUnison
member.summary: (PDF 1.5) If set, a group of radio buttons within a radio button field that use the same value for the on state will turn on and off in unison; that is if one is checked, they are all checked. If clear, the buttons are mutually exclusive (the same behavior as HTML radio buttons).

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Multiline
member.summary: If set, the field may contain multiple lines of text; if clear, the fields text is restricted to a single line.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Password
member.summary: If set, the field is intended for entering a secure password that should not be echoed visibly to the screen. Characters typed from the keyboard should instead be echoed in some unreadable form, such as asterisks or bullet characters. To protect password confidentiality, viewer applications should never store the value of the text field in the PDF file if this flag is set.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.FileSelect
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, the text entered in the field represents the pathname of a file whose contents are to be submitted as the value of the field.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.DoNotSpellCheckTextField
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, the text entered in the field will not be spell-checked.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.DoNotScroll
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, the field will not scroll (horizontally for single-line fields, vertically for multiple-line fields) to accommodate more text than will fit within its annotation rectangle. Once the field is full, no further text will be accepted.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Comb
member.summary: (PDF 1.5) May be set only if the MaxLen entry is present in the text field dictionary (see Table 229) and if the Multiline, Password, and FileSelect flags are clear. If set, the field shall be automatically divided into as many equally spaced positions, or combs, as the value of MaxLen, and the text is laid out into those combs.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.RichText
member.summary: (PDF 1.5) If set, the value of this field shall be a rich text string (see 12.7.3.4, Rich Text Strings). If the field has a value, the RV entry of the field dictionary (Table 222) shall specify the rich text string.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Combo
member.summary: If set, the field is a combo box; if clear, the field is a list box.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Edit
F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Sort
member.summary: If set, the fields option items should be sorted alphabetically. This flag is intended for use by form authoring tools, not by PDF viewer applications; viewers should simply display the options in the order in which they occur in the Opt array.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.MultiSelect
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, more than one of the fields option items may be selected simultaneously; if clear, no more than one item at a time may be selected.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.DoNotSpellCheckChoiseField
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, the text entered in the field will not be spell-checked. This flag is meaningful only if the Combo and Edit flags are both set.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary. The description comes from PDF 1.4 Reference.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.Page
member.summary: Optional: Reference to the Page object containing this field

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.FT
member.summary: (Required for terminal fields; inheritable) The type of field that this dictionary describes: Btn Button Tx Text Ch Choice Sig (PDF 1.3) Signature Note: This entry may be present in a nonterminal field (one whose descendants are themselves fields) in order to provide an inheritable FT value. However, a nonterminal field does not logically have a type of its own; it is merely a container for inheritable attributes that are intended for descendant terminal fields of any type.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.Parent
member.summary: (Required if this field is the child of another in the field hierarchy; absent otherwise) The field that is the immediate parent of this one (the field, if any, whose Kids array includes this field). A field can have at most one parent; that is, it can be included in the Kids array of at most one other field.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.Kids
member.summary: (Optional) An array of indirect references to the immediate children of this field.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.T
member.summary: (Optional) The partial field name.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.TU
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) An alternate field name, to be used in place of the actual field name wherever the field must be identified in the user interface (such as in error or status messages referring to the field). This text is also useful when extracting the documents contents in support of accessibility to disabled users or for other purposes.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.TM
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The mapping name to be used when exporting interactive form field data from the document.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.Ff
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) A set of flags specifying various characteristics of the field. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.V
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) The fields value, whose format varies depending on the field type; see the descriptions of individual field types for further information.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.DV
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) The default value to which the field reverts when a reset-form action is executed. The format of this value is the same as that of V.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.AA
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) An additional-actions dictionary defining the fields behavior in response to various trigger events. This entry has exactly the same meaning as the AA entry in an annotation dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.DR
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) A resource dictionary containing default resources (such as fonts, patterns, or color spaces) to be used by the appearance stream. At a minimum, this dictionary must contain a Font entry specifying the resource name and font dictionary of the default font for displaying the fields text.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.DA
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) The default appearance string, containing a sequence of valid page-content graphics or text state operators defining such properties as the fields text size and color.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.Q
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) A code specifying the form of quadding (justification) to be used in displaying the text: 0 Left-justified 1 Centered 2 Right-justified Default value: 0 (left-justified).

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm

member.summary: Gets the fields collection of this form.

member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary. The description comes from PDF 1.4 Reference.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.Fields
member.summary: (Required) An array of references to the documents root fields (those with no ancestors in the field hierarchy).

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.NeedAppearances
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to construct appearance streams and appearance dictionaries for all widget annotations in the document. Default value: false.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.SigFlags
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A set of flags specifying various document-level characteristics related to signature fields. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.CO
member.summary: (Required if any fields in the document have additional-actions dictionaries containing a C entry; PDF 1.3) An array of indirect references to field dictionaries with calculation actions, defining the calculation order in which their values will be recalculated when the value of any field changes.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.DR
member.summary: (Optional) A document-wide default value for the DR attribute of variable text fields.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.DA
member.summary: (Optional) A document-wide default value for the DA attribute of variable text fields.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.Q
member.summary: (Optional) A document-wide default value for the Q attribute of variable text fields.

member.summary: Gets or sets the List of options (entries) available for selection. This is the list of values shown in the UI.

member.summary: Gets the list of values for this Field. May or may not be equal to but has always the same amount of items.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfChoiceField.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary. The description comes from PDF 1.4 Reference.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfChoiceField.Keys.Opt
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) An array of options to be presented to the user. Each element of the array is either a text string representing one of the available options or a two-element array consisting of a text string together with a default appearance string for constructing the items appearance dynamically at viewing time.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfChoiceField.Keys.TI
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) For scrollable list boxes, the top index (the index in the Opt array of the first option visible in the list).

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfChoiceField.Keys.I
member.summary: (Sometimes required, otherwise optional; inheritable; PDF 1.4) For choice fields that allow multiple selection (MultiSelect flag set), an array of integers, sorted in ascending order, representing the zero-based indices in the Opt array of the currently selected option items. This entry is required when two or more elements in the Opt array have different names but the same export value, or when the value of the choice field is an array; in other cases, it is permitted but not required. If the items identified by this entry differ from those in the V entry of the field dictionary (see below), the V entry takes precedence.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField
member.summary: Represents the signature field.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary. The description comes from PDF 1.4 Reference.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Optional) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; if present, must be Sig for a signature dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Filter
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) The name of the signature handler to be used for authenticating the fields contents, such as Adobe.PPKLite, Entrust.PPKEF, CICI.SignIt, or VeriSign.PPKVS.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.SubFilter
member.summary: (Optional) The name of a specific submethod of the specified handler.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.ByteRange
member.summary: (Required) An array of pairs of integers (starting byte offset, length in bytes) describing the exact byte range for the digest calculation. Multiple discontinuous byte ranges may be used to describe a digest that does not include the signature token itself.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Contents
member.summary: (Required) The encrypted signature token.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Name
member.summary: (Optional) The name of the person or authority signing the document.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.M
member.summary: (Optional) The time of signing. Depending on the signature handler, this may be a normal unverified computer time or a time generated in a verifiable way from a secure time server.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Location
member.summary: (Optional) The CPU host name or physical location of the signing.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Reason
member.summary: (Optional) The reason for the signing, such as (I agree).

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.ContactInfo
member.summary: (Optional) Contact info of the signer.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfEmbeddedFile
member.summary: Represent a file stream embedded in the PDF document

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfEmbeddedFile.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this embedded file.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfEmbeddedFile.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Optional) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; if present, must be EmbeddedFile for an embedded file stream.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfEmbeddedFile.Keys.Subtype
member.summary: (Optional) The subtype of the embedded file. The value of this entry must be a first-class name, as defined in Appendix E. Names without a registered prefix must conform to the MIME media type names defined in Internet RFC 2046, Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME), Part Two: Media Types(see the Bibliography), with the provision that characters not allowed in names must use the 2-character hexadecimal code format described in Section 3.2.4, Name Objects.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfEmbeddedFile.Keys.Params
member.summary: (Optional) An embedded file parameter dictionary containing additional, file-specific information (see Table 3.43).

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfEmbeddedFile.Keys.Size
member.summary: (Optional) The size of the embedded file, in bytes.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfEmbeddedFile.Keys.CreationDate
member.summary: (Optional) The date and time when the embedded file was created.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfEmbeddedFile.Keys.ModDate
member.summary: (Optional) The date and time when the embedded file was last modified.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfEmbeddedFile.Keys.Mac
member.summary: (Optional) A subdictionary containing additional information specific to Mac OS files (see Table 3.44).

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfEmbeddedFile.Keys.CheckSum
member.summary: (Optional) A 16-byte string that is the checksum of the bytes of the uncompressed embedded file. The checksum is calculated by applying the standard MD5 message-digest algorithm (described in Internet RFC 1321, The MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm; see the Bibliography) to the bytes of the embedded file stream.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFileSpecification
member.summary: Represent a file stream embedded in the PDF document

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFileSpecification.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this embedded file.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFileSpecification.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Required if an EF or RF entry is present; recommended always) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be Filespec for a file specification dictionary (see implementation note 45 in Appendix H).

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFileSpecification.Keys.F
member.summary:
(Required if the DOS, Mac, and Unix entries are all absent; amended with the UF entry for PDF 1.7) A file specification string of the form described in Section 3.10.1, File Specification Strings, or (if the file system is URL) a uniform resource locator, as described in Section 3.10.4, URL Specifications.
Note: It is recommended that the UF entry be used in addition to the F entry. The UF entry provides cross-platform and cross-language compatibility and the F entry provides backwards compatibility

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFileSpecification.Keys.EF
member.summary:
(Required if RF is present; PDF 1.3; amended to include the UF key in PDF 1.7) A dictionary containing a subset of the keys F, UF, DOS, Mac, and Unix, corresponding to the entries by those names in the file specification dictionary. The value of each such key is an embedded file stream (see Section 3.10.3, Embedded File Streams) containing the corresponding file. If this entry is present, the Type entry is required and the file specification dictionary must be indirectly referenced. (See implementation note 46in Appendix H.)
Note: It is recommended that the F and UF entries be used in place of the DOS, Mac, or Unix entries.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFont
member.summary: Represents a PDF font.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFont.#ctor(PdfEdit.Pdf.PdfDocument)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFont.IsSymbolFont
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is symbol font.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFont.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys common to all font dictionaries.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFont.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Required) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be Font for a font dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFont.Keys.Subtype
member.summary: (Required) The type of font.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFont.Keys.BaseFont
member.summary: (Required) The PostScript name of the font.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFont.Keys.FontDescriptor
member.summary: (Required except for the standard 14 fonts; must be an indirect reference) A font descriptor describing the fonts metrics other than its glyph widths. Note: For the standard 14 fonts, the entries FirstChar, LastChar, Widths, and FontDescriptor must either all be present or all be absent. Ordinarily, they are absent; specifying them enables a standard font to be overridden.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor
member.summary: A PDF font descriptor specifies metrics and other attributes of a simple font, as distinct from the metrics of individual glyphs.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.FontName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the font.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.IsSymbolFont
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is symbol font.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Required) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be FontDescriptor for a font descriptor.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontName
member.summary: (Required) The PostScript name of the font. This name should be the same as the value of BaseFont in the font or CIDFont dictionary that refers to this font descriptor.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontFamily
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5; strongly recommended for Type 3 fonts in Tagged PDF documents) A string specifying the preferred font family name. For example, for the font Times Bold Italic, the FontFamily is Times.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontStretch
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5; strongly recommended for Type 3 fonts in Tagged PDF documents) The font stretch value. It must be one of the following names (ordered from narrowest to widest): UltraCondensed, ExtraCondensed, Condensed, SemiCondensed, Normal, SemiExpanded, Expanded, ExtraExpanded or UltraExpanded. Note: The specific interpretation of these values varies from font to font. For example, Condensed in one font may appear most similar to Normal in another.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontWeight
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5; strongly recommended for Type 3 fonts in Tagged PDF documents) The weight (thickness) component of the fully-qualified font name or font specifier. The possible values are 100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, or 900, where each number indicates a weight that is at least as dark as its predecessor. A value of 400 indicates a normal weight; 700 indicates bold. Note: The specific interpretation of these values varies from font to font. For example, 300 in one font may appear most similar to 500 in another.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Flags
member.summary: (Required) A collection of flags defining various characteristics of the font.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontBBox
member.summary: (Required, except for Type 3 fonts) A rectangle (see Section 3.8.4, Rectangles), expressed in the glyph coordinate system, specifying the font bounding box. This is the smallest rectangle enclosing the shape that would result if all of the glyphs of the font were placed with their origins coincident and then filled.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.ItalicAngle
member.summary: (Required) The angle, expressed in degrees counterclockwise from the vertical, of the dominant vertical strokes of the font. (For example, the 9-oclock position is 90 degrees, and the 3-oclock position is 90 degrees.) The value is negative for fonts that slope to the right, as almost all italic fonts do.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Ascent
member.summary: (Required, except for Type 3 fonts) The maximum height above the baseline reached by glyphs in this font, excluding the height of glyphs for accented characters.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Descent
member.summary: (Required, except for Type 3 fonts) The maximum depth below the baseline reached by glyphs in this font. The value is a negative number.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Leading
member.summary: (Optional) The spacing between baselines of consecutive lines of text. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.CapHeight
member.summary: (Required for fonts that have Latin characters, except for Type 3 fonts) The vertical coordinate of the top of flat capital letters, measured from the baseline.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.XHeight
member.summary: (Optional) The fonts x height: the vertical coordinate of the top of flat nonascending lowercase letters (like the letter x), measured from the baseline, in fonts that have Latin characters. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.StemV
member.summary: (Required, except for Type 3 fonts) The thickness, measured horizontally, of the dominant vertical stems of glyphs in the font.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.StemH
member.summary: (Optional) The thickness, measured vertically, of the dominant horizontal stems of glyphs in the font. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.AvgWidth
member.summary: (Optional) The average width of glyphs in the font. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.MaxWidth
member.summary: (Optional) The maximum width of glyphs in the font. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.MissingWidth
member.summary: (Optional) The width to use for character codes whose widths are not specified in a font dictionarys Widths array. This has a predictable effect only if all such codes map to glyphs whose actual widths are the same as the value of the MissingWidth entry. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontFile
member.summary: (Optional) A stream containing a Type 1 font program.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontFile2
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) A stream containing a TrueType font program.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontFile3
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) A stream containing a font program whose format is specified by the Subtype entry in the stream dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.CharSet
member.summary: (Optional; meaningful only in Type 1 fonts; PDF 1.1) A string listing the character names defined in a font subset. The names in this string must be in PDF syntaxthat is, each name preceded by a slash (/). The names can appear in any order. The name .notdef should be omitted; it is assumed to exist in the font subset. If this entry is absent, the only indication of a font subset is the subset tag in the FontName entry.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject
member.summary: Represents an external form object (e.g. an imported page).

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Resources
member.summary: Gets the PdfResources object of this form.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Optional) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; if present, must be XObject for a form XObject.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.Subtype
member.summary: (Required) The type of XObject that this dictionary describes; must be Form for a form XObject.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.FormType
member.summary: (Optional) A code identifying the type of form XObject that this dictionary describes. The only valid value defined at the time of publication is 1. Default value: 1.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.BBox
member.summary: (Required) An array of four numbers in the form coordinate system, giving the coordinates of the left, bottom, right, and top edges, respectively, of the form XObjects bounding box. These boundaries are used to clip the form XObject and to determine its size for caching.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.Matrix
member.summary: (Optional) An array of six numbers specifying the form matrix, which maps form space into user space. Default value: the identity matrix [1 0 0 1 0 0].

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.Resources
member.summary: (Optional but strongly recommended; PDF 1.2) A dictionary specifying any resources (such as fonts and images) required by the form XObject.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.Group
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A group attributes dictionary indicating that the contents of the form XObject are to be treated as a group and specifying the attributes of that group (see Section 4.9.2, Group XObjects). Note: If a Ref entry (see below) is present, the group attributes also apply to the external page imported by that entry, which allows such an imported page to be treated as a group without further modification.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfGroupAttributes
member.summary: Represents a PDF group XObject.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfGroupAttributes.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfGroupAttributes.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Optional) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; if present, must be Group for a group attributes dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfGroupAttributes.Keys.S
member.summary: (Required) The group subtype, which identifies the type of group whose attributes this dictionary describes and determines the format and meaning of the dictionarys remaining entries. The only group subtype defined in PDF 1.4 is Transparency. Other group subtypes may be added in the future.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage
member.summary: Represents an image.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.#ctor(PdfEdit.Pdf.PdfDocument,PdfEdit.Drawing.XImage)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of PdfImage from an XImage.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Image
member.summary: Gets the underlying XImage object.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.ToString
member.summary: Returns 'Image'.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys
member.summary: Common keys for all streams.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Optional) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; if present, must be XObject for an image XObject.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Subtype
member.summary: (Required) The type of XObject that this dictionary describes; must be Image for an image XObject.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Width
member.summary: (Required) The width of the image, in samples.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Height
member.summary: (Required) The height of the image, in samples.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.ColorSpace
member.summary: (Required for images, except those that use the JPXDecode filter; not allowed for image masks) The color space in which image samples are specified; it can be any type of color space except Pattern. If the image uses the JPXDecode filter, this entry is optional: If ColorSpace is present, any color space specifications in the JPEG2000 data are ignored. If ColorSpace is absent, the color space specifications in the JPEG2000 data are used. The Decode array is also ignored unless ImageMask is true.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.BitsPerComponent
member.summary: (Required except for image masks and images that use the JPXDecode filter) The number of bits used to represent each color component. Only a single value may be specified; the number of bits is the same for all color components. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, 8, and (in PDF 1.5) 16. If ImageMask is true, this entry is optional, and if specified, its value must be 1. If the image stream uses a filter, the value of BitsPerComponent must be consistent with the size of the data samples that the filter delivers. In particular, a CCITTFaxDecode or JBIG2Decode filter always delivers 1-bit samples, a RunLengthDecode or DCTDecode filter delivers 8-bit samples, and an LZWDecode or FlateDecode filter delivers samples of a specified size if a predictor function is used. If the image stream uses the JPXDecode filter, this entry is optional and ignored if present. The bit depth is determined in the process of decoding the JPEG2000 image.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Intent
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) The name of a color rendering intent to be used in rendering the image. Default value: the current rendering intent in the graphics state.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.ImageMask
member.summary: (Optional) A flag indicating whether the image is to be treated as an image mask. If this flag is true, the value of BitsPerComponent must be 1 and Mask and ColorSpace should not be specified; unmasked areas are painted using the current nonstroking color. Default value: false.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Mask
member.summary: (Optional except for image masks; not allowed for image masks; PDF 1.3) An image XObject defining an image mask to be applied to this image, or an array specifying a range of colors to be applied to it as a color key mask. If ImageMask is true, this entry must not be present.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Decode
member.summary: (Optional) An array of numbers describing how to map image samples into the range of values appropriate for the images color space. If ImageMask is true, the array must be either [0 1] or [1 0]; otherwise, its length must be twice the number of color components required by ColorSpace. If the image uses the JPXDecode filter and ImageMask is false, Decode is ignored. Default value: see Decode Arrays.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Interpolate
member.summary: (Optional) A flag indicating whether image interpolation is to be performed. Default value: false.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Alternates
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) An array of alternate image dictionaries for this image. The order of elements within the array has no significance. This entry may not be present in an image XObject that is itself an alternate image.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.SMask
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A subsidiary image XObject defining a soft-mask image to be used as a source of mask shape or mask opacity values in the transparent imaging model. The alpha source parameter in the graphics state determines whether the mask values are interpreted as shape or opacity. If present, this entry overrides the current soft mask in the graphics state, as well as the images Mask entry, if any. (However, the other transparency related graphics state parameters blend mode and alpha constant remain in effect.) If SMask is absent, the image has no associated soft mask (although the current soft mask in the graphics state may still apply).

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.SMaskInData
member.summary: (Optional for images that use the JPXDecode filter, meaningless otherwise; PDF 1.5) A code specifying how soft-mask information encoded with image samples should be used: 0 If present, encoded soft-mask image information should be ignored. 1 The images data stream includes encoded soft-mask values. An application can create a soft-mask image from the information to be used as a source of mask shape or mask opacity in the transparency imaging model. 2 The images data stream includes color channels that have been preblended with a background; the image data also includes an opacity channel. An application can create a soft-mask image with a Matte entry from the opacity channel information to be used as a source of mask shape or mask opacity in the transparency model. If this entry has a nonzero value, SMask should not be specified. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Name
member.summary: (Required in PDF 1.0; optional otherwise) The name by which this image XObject is referenced in the XObject subdictionary of the current resource dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.StructParent
member.summary: (Required if the image is a structural content item; PDF 1.3) The integer key of the images entry in the structural parent tree.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.ID
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3; indirect reference preferred) The digital identifier of the images parent Web Capture content set.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.OPI
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) An OPI version dictionary for the image. If ImageMask is true, this entry is ignored.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Metadata
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A metadata stream containing metadata for the image.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.OC
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5) An optional content group or optional content membership dictionary, specifying the optional content properties for this image XObject. Before the image is processed, its visibility is determined based on this entry. If it is determined to be invisible, the entire image is skipped, as if there were no Do operator to invoke it.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfInternals.GetClosure(PdfEdit.Pdf.PdfObject)
member.summary: Returns an array containing the specified object as first element follows by its transitive closure. The closure of an object are all objects that can be reached by indirect references. The transitive closure is the result of applying the calculation of the closure to a closure as long as no new objects came along. This is e.g. useful for getting all objects belonging to the resources of a page.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Pdf.Advanced.PdfInternals.GetClosure(PdfEdit.Pdf.PdfObject,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an array containing the specified object as first element follows by its transitive closure limited by the specified number of iterations.
